channel.title: One Year Later
channel.description:
One Year Later is a special series that takes a new approach to the national political debate. A year after a polarizing election, three hosts, each with a distinct perspective, speak honestly about America's differences and look for ways to bridge the country's divides.
What's your perspective? Call us at 424-272-7082 ! Share your thoughts .
channel.itunes:summary:
One Year Later is a special series that takes a new approach to the national political debate. A year after a polarizing election, three hosts, each with a distinct perspective, speak honestly about America's differences and look for ways to bridge the country's divides.
What's your perspective? Call us at 424-272-7082 ! Share your thoughts .
channel.media:description: One Year Later is a special series that takes a new approach to the national political debate.
channel.itunes:author: KCRW

item.title: President Trump and the imagined war on Christmas
item.itunes:title: President Trump and the imagined war on Christmas
item.description: President Trump’s first year in office has impacted Americans well beyond policy. He’s in every story, in everything, it seems. On our final show, we look at how he and Republicans have even politicized Christmas. We discuss how Americans celebrate in ways that look different than a Hallmark card — including people who want their holiday symbols, like Santa — to look like them.
item.itunes:summary: President Trump’s first year in office has impacted Americans well beyond policy. He’s in every story, in everything, it seems. On our final show, we look at how he and Republicans have even politicized Christmas. We discuss how Americans celebrate in ways that look different than a Hallmark card — including people who want their holiday symbols, like Santa — to look like them.

On our final show, we look at how he and Republicans have even politicized Christmas. We discuss how Americans celebrate in ways that look different than a Hallmark card — including people who want their holiday symbols, like Santa — to look like them.

item.title: The politics of pot
item.itunes:title: The politics of pot
item.description: Recreational marijuana will be legal in California in 2018. Who will benefit from the potential economic boom?

item.title: What the tax bill has to do with U.S. wealth inequality
item.itunes:title: What the tax bill has to do with U.S. wealth inequality
item.description: The richest one percent of Americans control about 38 percent of the wealth in the United States. Analysts report that the Republican tax bill, very soon to be the Republican tax law, will only exacerbate the problem. How will this break down on racial and ethnic lines? Who benefits and who doesn't?
item.itunes:summary: The richest one percent of Americans control about 38 percent of the wealth in the United States. item.title: Trump is rapidly reshaping the federal courts
item.itunes:title: Trump is rapidly reshaping the federal courts
item.description: President Trump is often criticized for not having any “major accomplishments.”  However, his judicial picks, including Neil Gorsuch, could have a more lasting impact than any bill he signs. Barring impeachment or resignation, these judges — almost all white, conservative men — will have their jobs for life.
item.itunes:summary: President Trump is often criticized for not having any “major accomplishments.” However, his judicial picks, including Neil Gorsuch, could have a more lasting impact than any bill he signs. Barring impeachment or resignation, these judges — almost all white, conservative men — will have their jobs for life.

item.title: Puerto Rico's long road to recovery
item.itunes:title: Puerto Rico's long road to recovery
item.description: Almost three months after Hurricane Maria made landfall in Puerto Rico, the U.S. territory is still struggling to get basic necessities like water and power. The islands were already dealing with a crushing amount of debt before the storms, how should the U.S. help its territory recover?
item.itunes:summary: Almost three months after Hurricane Maria made landfall in Puerto Rico, the U.S. territory is still struggling to get basic necessities like water and power. The islands were already dealing with a crushing amount of debt before the storms, how should the U.S. help its territory recover?

item.title: What does the film 'Coco' mean for the Latino community?
item.itunes:title: What does the film 'Coco' mean for the Latino community?
item.description: The film Coco has resonated with Latinos in the US who have been battered by the anti-Latino rhetoric coming out of the White House. Can a Pixar hit and it's loveable protagonist boost a community's self esteem?
item.itunes:summary: The film Coco has resonated with Latinos in the US who have been battered by the anti-Latino rhetoric coming out of the White House. Can a Pixar hit and it's loveable protagonist boost a community's self esteem?

item.title: Immigration crackdown shifts to country's interior
item.itunes:title: Immigration crackdown shifts to country's interior
item.description: As a candidate, President Trump promised to round up and deport "bad hombres." But a spike in deportations and arrests are also sweeping up immigrants with deep ties to the United States and minor or no criminal history. Seizures in the interior of the country have increased 42 percent over last year. Grassroots groups and clergy have stepping up to try to shield immigrants.
item.itunes:summary: As a candidate, President Trump promised to round up and deport "bad hombres." But a spike in deportations and arrests are also sweeping up immigrants with deep ties to the United States and minor or no criminal history. Seizures in the interior of the country have increased 42 percent over last year. Grassroots groups and clergy have stepping up to try to shield immigrants.

item.title: A turf war over public lands
item.itunes:title: A turf war over public lands
item.description: President Trump waded into a decades old battle over federal public lands when he announced he was drastically scaling back two national monuments created by Presidents Clinton and Obama. We explore the future of public lands and the Antiquities Act.
item.itunes:summary: President Trump waded into a decades old battle over federal public lands when he announced he was drastically scaling back two national monuments created by Presidents Clinton and Obama. We explore the future of public lands and the Antiquities Act.

item.title: Elitism in America
item.itunes:title: Elitism in America
item.description: Much of the criticism of liberals after the 2016 election revolved around coastal elites and the media being disconnected from white working class Americans. Are the "Blue Coasts" still mocking the flyover states -- and helping empower Trump in the process?
item.itunes:summary: Much of the criticism of liberals after the 2016 election revolved around coastal elites and the media being disconnected from white working class Americans. Are the "Blue Coasts" still mocking the flyover states -- and helping empower Trump in the process?

item.title: Are immigrant workers bad for the working class?
item.itunes:title: Are immigrant workers bad for the working class?
item.description: Populists on the Left and Nativists on the Right seem to agree on one thing: that a ready supply of immigrant workers is undermining American workers. But with unemployment at new lows, are US workers just scapegoating immigrants?
item.itunes:summary: Populists on the Left and Nativists on the Right seem to agree on one thing: that a ready supply of immigrant workers is undermining American workers. But with unemployment at new lows, are US workers just scapegoating immigrants?

item.title: Can Democrats capitalize on Republican woes?
item.itunes:title: Can Democrats capitalize on Republican woes?
item.description: President Trump's approval ratings are at historic lows.The GOP's tax and healthcare bills have been panned. Sexual misconduct scandals may define the party. Democrats are being handed a golden opportunity, but will they blow it?
item.itunes:summary: President Trump's approval ratings are at historic lows.The GOP's tax and healthcare bills have been panned. Sexual misconduct scandals may define the party. Democrats are being handed a golden opportunity, but will they blow it?

item.title: Is Trump a threat to the rule of law?
item.itunes:title: Is Trump a threat to the rule of law?
item.description: The president has gone after the FBI, judges and the First Amendment. But so far his vendetta against so-called sanctuary cities has failed and his attorney general won't start an investigation against Hillary Clinton. Will he spark a Constitutional standoff with the special counsel?  Is the GOP forfeiting its claim to be the party of law and order?
item.itunes:summary: The president has gone after the FBI, judges and the First Amendment. But so far his vendetta against so-called sanctuary cities has failed and his attorney general won't start an investigation against Hillary Clinton. Will he spark a Constitutional standoff with the special counsel? Is the GOP forfeiting its claim to be the party of law and order?

item.itunes:keywords: sexual harassment,Roy Moore,Al Franken,partisan politics,rule of law,misinformation,obstruction of justice,Mueller investigation,impeachment,abuse of power,tax bill,alternate minimum tax,Jerusalem
item.content:encoded: The president has gone after the FBI, judges and the First Amendment. Will he spark a Constitutional standoff with the special counsel?  Is the GOP forfeiting its claim to be the party of law and order?

item.title: Young conservatives and the future of the GOP
item.itunes:title: Young conservatives and the future of the GOP
item.description: Millennials will soon be the largest voting bloc in US political history. They're less motivated by party affiliation than Baby Boomers, but they are overwhelmingly anti-Trump. Can they break the partisan log-jam?
item.itunes:summary: Millennials will soon be the largest voting bloc in US political history. They're less motivated by party affiliation than Baby Boomers, but they are overwhelmingly anti-Trump. Can they break the partisan log-jam?

item.title: Why are so many Evangelicals standing by Trump?
item.itunes:title: Why are so many Evangelicals standing by Trump?
item.description: The executive power to make judicial appointments is helping drive evangelicals support for President Trump -- and now Roy Moore. item.title: Parenting in the age of Trump
item.itunes:title: Parenting in the age of Trump
item.description: President Trump confounds and infuriates his political critics. He also has many parents tearing their hair out. They want their kids to be kind, honest and polite but when the president is the bully-in-chief what do they tell their kids?

item.title: How Donald Trump unites Democrats and Republicans – against him
item.itunes:title: How Donald Trump unites Democrats and Republicans – against him
item.description: Longtime conservative Bill Kristol has become a liberal icon of sorts in his opposition to Trump. Kristol rocked the political world when he tweeted, "The GOP tax bill's bringing out my inner socialist." From sex scandals to fiscal reform, some loyal Republicans think the party has gone off the rails. Is the party rescuable?
item.itunes:summary: Longtime conservative Bill Kristol has become a liberal icon of sorts in his opposition to Trump. item.title: Washington's swamp keeps getting deeper
item.itunes:title: Washington's swamp keeps getting deeper
item.description: Donald Trump promised to drain the swamp but so far he's expanded it. We've seen nepotism, conflicts of interest, self-dealing and lots and lots of lying. And we're not even a year into his presidency. Is Trump going to make Washington even sleazier? Where is the Congressional oversight? Do Americans care if the president is making money off his office?
item.itunes:summary: Donald Trump promised to drain the swamp but so far he's expanded it. We've seen nepotism, conflicts of interest, self-dealing and lots and lots of lying. And we're not even a year into his presidency. Is Trump going to make Washington even sleazier? Where is the Congressional oversight? Do Americans care if the president is making money off his office?

item.title: Breitbart, fake news and the First Amendment
item.itunes:title: Breitbart, fake news and the First Amendment
item.description: The Trump Administration has gone to war with the mainstream media and the First Amendment. Trump thinks letting the press write whatever it wants is a terrible idea. Meanwhile a right wing mouthpiece for Trump may be taking over your local TV news. Is the president a threat to a free press? Can the mainstream media cover him objectively?
item.itunes:summary: The Trump Administration has gone to war with the mainstream media and the First Amendment. Trump thinks letting the press write whatever it wants is a terrible idea. item.title: When the sports field becomes a political battlefield

item.description: Race and sports have always been intertwined in America — but under Trump, they are inseparable in a new way. Why does the president repeatedly single out sports figures of color for criticism?

item.title: The religious left raises its voice
item.itunes:title: The religious left raises its voice
item.description: For decades, the political right has made religiosity their brand. But a "religious left" has risen since President Trump's election, and progressive clergy members have witnessed a renewal of interest in spirituality. Have evangelical conservatives finally met their match in the political arena?

item.title: Why won't the debate over the Civil War go away?
item.itunes:title: Why won't the debate over the Civil War go away?
item.description: The Civil War may have ended more than 152 years ago, but the battle over the national memory of the conflict -- and the motive for Southern secession -- has flared anew. From confederate monument defenders on the streets to the pop historians in the White House, the whitewashed "Lost Cause" rationale -- of Southern honor and states' rights -- is getting a new lease on life in 2017.

item.title: Growing up black with Trump in the White House
item.itunes:title: Growing up black with Trump in the White House
item.description: Donald Trump's exploitation of white racial resentment helped cement his victory in 2016, but it also revealed a lot about our culture. When One Year Later host Jamil Smith visited his hometown in Cleveland, he spoke with young black students at his high school about what it's like to live through the Trump presidency.

item.itunes:author: KCRW
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump's exploitation of white racial resentment helped cement his victory in 2016, but it also revealed a lot about our culture. When One Year Later host Jamil Smith visited his hometown in Cleveland, he spoke with young black students at his high school about what it's like to live through the Trump presidency.

item.title: Second Amendment, guns, and race
item.itunes:title: Second Amendment, guns, and race
item.description: Social science researchers have found that support for gun rights is strongest among whites who are racially prejudiced. However, since Donald Trump's election, it's black Americans who feel the need to protect themselves. Does everyone have the same Second Amendment rights?
